metadata.title: CVE-2014-9114 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Blkid in util-linux before 2.26rc-1 allows local users to execute arbitrarycode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 1:2.26.2-6ubuntu3
libblkid1 - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
libfdisk1 - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
libmount1 - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
libsmartcols1 - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
libuuid1 - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
mount - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
util-linux - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
util-linux-locales - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
uuid-runtime - 2.26.2-6ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
util-linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
